problem: Think step by step and answer in short: Given that $13^{-1} \equiv 29 \pmod{47}$, find $34^{-1} \pmod{47}$, as a residue modulo 47.  (Give a number between 0 and 46, inclusive.)
pred:
We have that $34 \equiv 13 \cdot 2 \pmod{47}$.  Taking the inverse of both sides, we get
\[34^{-1} \equiv (13 \cdot 2)^{-1} \equiv 2^{-1} \cdot 13^{-1} \equiv 2^{-1} \cdot 29 \pmod{47}.\]Since $2 \cdot 24 = 48 \equiv 1 \pmod{47},$ $2^{-1} \equiv 24 \pmod{47}.$  Therefore,
\[34^{-1} \equiv 24 \cdot 29 \equiv \boxed{37} \pmod{47}.\]
